class_notes: (ON CAMPUS) (Same as HC 618 1)In addition to close reading of the "moral part" of Summa Theologiae, we will attend to (a) the incarnation, life of Christ, and sacraments treated in the third part as a pedagogical principle of moral formation in the Summa; (b) the lasting legacy of Thomas's ethics in the history of Christian thought, especially in twentieth-century political theology and Catholic Social Teaching; and (c) the prospects of retrieving Thomistic ethics in the light of contemporary challenges from marginalized voices.
course_description: Thomas's treatment of the foundations of ethics, including topics such as human action, free will, the passions, habits, vice and virtue, and law, as explained in his Summa Theologiae. Teaching involves lectures, seminars, and close reading of primary texts. (Theology)
